methodology: Automated scorer (benchmarks/score.py) — zero LLM involvement. 11 check types: AST parsing, pytest execution, grep patterns, file existence, test counting.

tickets.task: Security audit: fix all validation gaps

bench6.finding: Quality perfectly consistent (0 std dev). Cost varies 6x across identical runs.

bench7.finding: Quality ceiling at 80/100 — model consistently misses transactional rollback. Running more times cannot fix this.

anvil_lite_bench6.note: Same quality as freestyle. Governance phases add $2.25 overhead. Verification caught residual mutation and forced retry.

key_findings: BENCH-7 has a hard quality ceiling: 80/100 across all 5 runs — model never implements transactional rollback
BENCH-6 quality: 90/100 on all 7 runs (0 std dev) — perfectly consistent
BENCH-6 cost: $0.24-$1.45 across runs (6x range) — cost unpredictability is the risk, not quality variance
Anvil lite: 90/100 on BENCH-6 with $2.25 governance overhead — same quality, auditable process
Holdout validation is designed to break quality ceilings: adversarial tests check for specific failure modes like missing rollback
Scorer discriminates: unfixed baselines 39-48%, both approaches improve to 80-100%
